uqa.list_utils module¶

Helper functions for list and iterables.

uqa.list_utils.T = ~T¶

A generic type

uqa.list_utils.PredicateT = typing.Callable[[~T], bool]¶

A predicate over T type elements.

uqa.list_utils.split_chunks(seq: Sequence[T], n: int) → Iterable[List[T]][source]¶

Return an iterator with n chunks of seq elements with approximatly the same size.

uqa.list_utils.find(seq: Sequence[T], pred=typing.Callable[[~ T], bool]) → int[source]¶

Find the first element of seq which holds True for prdeicate`pred` and returns its index or -1 if none found.

uqa.list_utils.find_all(seq: Sequence[T], pred=typing.Callable[[~ T], bool]) → List[int][source]¶

Find all elements of seq which hold True for predicate pred and returns their indices.

uqa.list_utils.find_subseq(seq: Sequence[T], sub_seq: Sequence[T]) → int[source]¶

Find the first occurence of sub_seq in seq, if found returns the index of the first element, else returns -1.

uqa.list_utils.find_subseq_spaced(seq: Sequence[T], sub_seq: Sequence[T]) → List[int][source]¶

If the subsequence sub_seq can be derived from seq return the indices sub_seq elements in seq else return an empty list.

A subsequence is derived from a sequence by removing 0 or more elements from the sequence without changing the order of the remaining elements. If multiple results are possible returns the smallest one in terms of indices.

uqa.list_utils.first_segment_where(seq: Sequence[T], pred: Callable[[T], bool], start: int = 0, stop: Optional[int] = None) → Tuple[Optional[int], Optional[int]][source]¶

Returns the indices of the first segment of seq where all elements verify pred. If no elements verify pred returns (-1, -1).

Parameters

  • seq (Sequence[T]) – Sequence of elements

  • pred (PredicateT) – Predicate on the elements of seq.

  • start (int) – Index of the first element to consider.

  • stop (int) – Index of the last element to consider plus 1.

Returns

i, j (Tuple[int, int]) – If i and j are not -1, then seq[i] is the first element of seq[start:stop] for which pred returns True and seq[j] is the first element of seq[i:stop] for which pred returns False.

uqa.list_utils.rd_it(seq: Sequence[T]) → Iterable[T][source]¶

Create a shuffled shallow copy of seq and iterate over it.
